meanings.sent1: Tom and Mary decided to frig in the park.
meanings.sent2: Cats and dogs frig to reproduce.
meanings.sent3: The birds outside were chirping loudly, interrupting their frigging session.
meanings.sent4: The dancers on stage moved in perfect harmony, as if they were frigging with the music.
meanings.sent5: The chef expertly frigged the ingredients together to create a delicious dish.

meanings.definition: An exclamation of annoyance or frustration.
meanings.sent1: Oh frig, I forgot my keys at home!
meanings.sent2: Frig! The rain ruined our picnic plans.
meanings.sent3: Frig it, I'll just order takeout for dinner.
meanings.sent4: The frigging printer jammed again, causing delays.
meanings.sent5: Frig this traffic, I'll never make it to the meeting on time!
